entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:43AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow On The Taylor Highway Above 3000 feet Through Tonight... Snow is expect over summits of the Taylor Highway through tonight with up to 3 inches of accumulation through tonight. Hunters and motorists venturing above 3000 feet should prepare for up to 3 inches of accumulation through tonight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:43AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall In Eastern Alaska Range Through Tonight... Snow is falling in the Eastern Alaska Range above 2500 feet, with heavier snow above 3500 feet. The Richardson Highway from Black Rapids south could see 3 to 6 inches of accumulation through Wednesday night. Above 3500 feet, which is higher than the highway could see up to one foot of accumulation through tonight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 12:18PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County north of Winslow through 1245 PM MST... SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 2:49AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...One more cool day with showers and thunderstorms... * Showers and thunderstorms can be expected this morning, with increased chances again this afternoon. Fast storm motions will help to mitigate flash flood risks. Generally, rainfall accumulations will be a few hundredths up to a few tenths of an inch, but localized areas could pick up to 0.5".
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...Heat Index Values of 100 to 105 expected today... One more day of record heat is expected across the quad-state region today. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty winds expected through Wednesday... entry.title: High Wind Watch issued September 21 at 2:28AM MDT until September 23 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills
